page.title: 20A day in an old man's life
page.content: I got up at half past six, washed, shaved and went downstairs to make some breakfast for my wife and I. Then I washed up the crockery and utensils, then went into the garden to have a look around. I cut the grass and clipped around the edges then hoed between the vegetables. After this I set two rows of beans and peas. This done I went in to get the lunch ready for half past one when my wife came home. She had been helping the Red Cross in Bedford. After luch we washed up then sat down for a cup of tea and a rest. At half past two we went out in the car to the Milton Ernest Garden Centre to buy some plants. Then we came home and I planted them in some tubs and pots. After this I tidied up the mess and swept round the paths. Then I went in.
